name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook spaghetti pasta according to package instructions and drain.
Cut bacon into small pieces and cook until crispy in a large skillet over medium heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together eggs, parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
Add cooked spaghetti to the skillet with the bacon and stir to combine.
Turn off the heat and pour the egg mixture over the spaghetti, stirring quickly to coat the pasta evenly.
Serve immediately with additional parmesan cheese and black pepper on top.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook spaghetti pasta according to package instructions and drain.

Serve immediately with additional parmesan cheese and black pepper on top.

name: Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Add chopped onion, garlic, and ginger and cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
Add chicken breast and cook until browned on all sides.
Add curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and salt and stir to coat the chicken.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes until chicken is cooked through and tender.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

name: Roasted Beet Salad
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Wash beets and wrap them in aluminum foil.
Place wrapped beets on a baking sheet and roast for 45-50 minutes or until tender.
Remove from oven, let cool, and peel off skin.
Cut beets into small pieces.
In a large bowl, toss mixed greens with olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and black pepper.
Add roasted beets, goat cheese, and walnuts to the bowl and toss to combine.
Serve immediately.

name: Beef Stew
instructions: Cut beef chuck roast into cubes and season with salt and black pepper.
Dredge the beef in flour, shaking off any excess.
Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Add beef and cook until browned on all sides.
Remove beef from the pot and set aside.
Add chopped onion and garlic to the pot and cook until translucent.
Stir in tomato paste, thyme, and rosemary and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add beef broth and bring to a simmer.
Return beef to the pot and add diced potatoes and carrots.
Simmer for 1-2 hours or until beef and vegetables are tender.
Serve hot.

name: Chocolate Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour two 9-inch round baking pans.
In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add eggs, milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract to the bowl and mix well.
Stir in boiling water to the mixture. The batter will be thin.
Pour the batter evenly into the two prepared pans.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and let cool in pans for 10 minutes.
Remove cakes from pans and let them cool completely on a wire rack.
Frost with your favorite frosting and decorate as desired.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add onion, garlic, carrots, and celery and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking up any large clumps with a spoon.
Add canned tomatoes, tomato paste, red wine, beef broth, oregano, basil, salt, and black pepper to the pot.
Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and let simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over cooked spaghetti and top with grated parmesan cheese.

name: Veggie Burger
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, mash chickpeas with a fork or potato masher.
Add cooked brown rice, diced onion, minced garlic, grated carrot, diced red bell pepper, bread crumbs, egg, cumin, coriander, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the bowl.
Mix well until all ingredients are combined.
Form mixture into 4 patties.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook patties for 4-5 minutes per side or until golden brown and crispy.
Assemble burgers by placing a veggie patty on a hamburger bun, topped with lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise.
Serve immediately.
